- European Glaucoma Society (EUGS). Terminology and guidelines for glaucoma (4th edition). Savona: Publicomm, 2014. - Hodapp E, Parrish RKI, Anderson DR. Clinical decisions in glaucoma. St Louis: The CV Mosby Co, 1993.
Aitor Eguzkitza, Universidad Pública de Navarra - Complejo Hospitalario de Navarra<aitor.eguzkiza@unavarra.es>

details.purpose: Register clinical findings on eye related with the diagnose of glaucoma.
details.use: Support the archetypes used in the study and diagnose of glaucoma to register clinical findings in a structured manner.

items.items: Clinical findings on eye related with the diagnose of glaucoma.
Findings on RNFL supporting the current study of glaucoma.
Findings on optic disc supporting the current study of glaucoma.
Identification of hemorrhages on or bordering the optic disc.
Narrative description of diffuse or localized abnormalities of the peripapillary retinal nerve fiber layer, especially at the inferior or superior poles.
Staging of the visual field defectsaccording to the Hodapp-Parrish classification (see references).
Findings on visual field supporting the current study of glaucoma.

Mean defect < -6dB; Fewer than 18 points depressed below the 5% probability level; Fewer than 10 points below the p < 1% level; No point in the central 5 degrees with a sensitivity of less than 15 dB.
Mean defect < -12dB; Fewer than 37 points depressed below the 5% probability level; Fewer than 20 points below the p < 1% level; Only one hemifield with a sensitivity of less than 15 dB.

Mean defect > -12dB; More than 37 points depressed below the 5% probability level; More than 20 points below the p < 1% level; Absolute deficit (0dB) in the 5 central degrees; Sensitivity <15dB in the 5 central degrees in both hemifields.
Visual field loss in one hemifield that is different from the other hemifield, i.e., across the horizontal midline (in early/moderate cases).
Document the insertion level of the iris root before and during compression dynamic gonioscopy.
Ratio of slit thickness of the cornea to the depth of the anterior chamber.

Description of the pattern of neuroretinal rim loss. It may take the form of diffuse thinning, focal narrowing, or localized notching of the optic disc rim, especially at the inferior or superior poles.
Identification of retinal nerve fiber layer thinning defects.
Diffuse thinning of Retinal nerve fiber layer.
Identification of progressive thinning of the neuroretinal rim with an associated increase in cupping of the optic disc.
Description of any positional changes of the vessels at the optic disc with bending, bayoneting or baring of circumlinear vessels.
Narrative description of overall findings, inlcuding those not considered above.
Description of features in optic nerve head (ONH).
Identification of hemorrhages on the peripapillary retinal nerve fiber layer.
Optic disc neural rim asymmetry of the two eyes consistent with loss of neural tissue.
